Container.Name: binhex-code-server
Container.Overview: Code-server is a Visual Studio Code instance running on a remote server accessible through any web browser. It allows you to code anywhere and on any device such as a tablet or laptop with a consistent integrated development environment (IDE). Set up a secure a Linux development machine and get coding on any device with a web browser. Take advantage of a cloud server by offloading the system demanding tasks such as tests, compilations, downloads to another machine. Preserve battery life when youâ€™re on the go or spend your downtime doing something else while the computationally intensive processes are running on your cloud server.

Config.Name: Port: Web Interface
Config.Description: This is the Web UI port for for the application.

Config.Name: Path: /config
Config.Description: This is the container path to your configuration files, e.g. databases, configuration files, logs etc.

Config.Name: Path: /data
Config.Description: This is the container path to your downloaded files or user created content.

Config.Name: Variable: CERT_PATH
Config.Description: Specify the path to the certificate used for SSL/TLS.

Config.Name: Variable: CERT_KEY_PATH
Config.Description: Specify the path to the certificate key used for SSL/TLS.

Config.Name: Variable: SELF_SIGNED_CERT
Config.Description: Specify whether to use a self-signed certificate.

Config.Name: Variable: BIND_CLOUD_NAME
Config.Description: Specify the bind cloud name used for SSL/TLS.

Config.Name: Variable: ENABLE_STARTUP_SCRIPTS
Config.Description: Specify whether to run startup scripts to install and/or configure additional applications.

Config.Name: Variable: PASSWORD
Config.Description: Specify the password used to access the Web UI.

Config.Name: Variable: HEALTHCHECK_COMMAND
Config.Description: The command or script to execute, if not specified then the script healthcheck.sh will be used (process, dns and https checking).

Config.Name: Variable: HEALTHCHECK_ACTION
Config.Description: The action to execute if the healthcheck command returns a non zero exit code, if not specified the action will be 'exit 1', if you want the container to exit on failure then set the action to 'kill 1'.

Config.Name: Variable: HEALTHCHECK_HOSTNAME
Config.Description: The hostname used when performing HTTPS and DNS healthchecking.

Config.Name: Variable: PUID
Config.Description: User ID for the running container

Config.Name: Variable: PGID
Config.Description: Group ID for the running container
